title.narrative: Provision of Health and Nutrition Services to Conflict Affected Internally Displaced People (IDPs), Returnees and conflict affected Host communities in Nangarhar and Faryab provinces of Afghanistan.

description.narrative: The program action aims to reduce the vulnerability of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and other vulnerable in host communities through provision of integrated lifesaving health and nutrition services in five priority districts of, Nangarhar province (Acheen, Hesarak, Khogayani, Shirzad, Chaparhar) and two priority districts of Faryab (Pashtun Kot and Maymana) province of Afghanistan. In the proposed project, AADA intends to undertake the following key interventions: A. Health: 1. Establish and maintain three First Aid Trauma Post (FATPs) in Nangarhar, one in Ragha Comprehensive Health Center (CHC) of Hassrak district, one in Zawa Basinc Health Center (BHC) of Khogayani district and one in Mama Khel CHC of Shirzad district. 2. Establish and maintain one FATP in Baghak Health Sub Center (HSC) of Pashtoon Kot district and due to excesses needs, reinforce and maintain the previously World Health Organization (WHO) supported Trauma Care Unit (TCU) in Maymana provincial hospital by assigning additional human resource and provision of medical supplies to provide specialized trauma management services to massive casualties and conflict induced trauma cases referred from districts. B. Nutrition: Deployment of six integrated mobile health and nutrition teams (MHNTs) covering 30 sites in Nangarhar (Two MHNTs in Acheen district, one in Chaparhar, two in Khogayani and one in Lalpur district to provide: 1. Outpatient Department of Severe Acute Malnutrition (OPD-SAM services for the management of severely malnourished boys and girls (6 to 59 months). 2. Outpatient Department of moderately malnourished for the management of severely malnourished boys and girls (6 to 59 months) and acutely malnourished pregnant and lactating women (PLW). 3. Promote optimal Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) among the IDPs, returnees and host communities. 4. Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illnesses (IMNCI) to children under five years old age antenatal care to pregnant women, health education and psychosocial counseling to mothers and caretakers. If the need will arise in other districts of Nangarhar, some of the MHNTs will be shifted to those districts of greater concerns. AADA is BPHS implementer NGO in Nangarhar and Faryab provinces and will ensure increased access to the selected districts. The proposed action will target 87,407 direct beneficiaries including 20,351 women and 33,752 girls. AADA will implement this project in coordination with all relevant actors at the national, provincial and community
